definition: to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li

sentences.english: I let the plane down gently, pulled off the runway, and taxied back to parking.
sentences.chinese: 我稳稳地降落了飞机，驶离跑道，滑行回了停机场。

sentences.english: The ship is standing off to sea.
sentences.chinese: 船在驶离海岸，开向大海。

sentences.english: About eight of these massive ships leave every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天大约有八艘这样的巨轮驶离港口。

sentences.english: The south side of old Hsi-Kou Station. 1968.
sentences.chinese: 南下列车驶离昔日的旧溪口站南端。

sentences.english: We pushed off frow the shore and were soon out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘船驶离岸边，不久就到了海上。

sentences.english: He sped his car off the accidental site.
sentences.chinese: 他加快车速驶离了出事地点。

sentences.english: If you're in a car, move away from bridges or elevated highways that can collapse.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在车内，驶离可能发生坍塌的桥梁和高速公路。

sentences.english: They got to the station too late; the coach was pulling out.
sentences.chinese: 他们晚了一步到达车站，客车正好驶离。

sentences.english: The train surged off the small station.
sentences.chinese: 列车轰隆隆地驶离了小站。

sentences.english: When he caromed off the wall, he was going 86 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 当他驶离水泥墙，车速依然达每小时86英里。

sentences.english: The ship hauled off the island to the big ship.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船驶离了小岛向大船靠去。

sentences.english: Her train huffed out of the town.
sentences.chinese: 她乘坐的火车喷着气驶离了城镇。

sentences.english: On June 6, the ship completed the departure formalities and from the port of Cape Town.
sentences.chinese: 6月6日，该船办妥相关离港手续并驶离开普敦港。

sentences.english: Then I heard the train stutter out of the staiton.
sentences.chinese: 后来，我听到火车突突地驶离了车站。

sentences.english: The truck left the loading dock with hoses still attached.
sentences.chinese: 卡车驶离装货月台时塑料水龙带还连在上面。

definition: (of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
to leave port/to put off
bound for
to go (of car, train etc)/to drive off
to call at/to stop at/berth
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to drive a vehicle
tone (of voice)/tune
variant of 掉頭|掉头[diao4 tou2]
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
to anchor/anchorage/mooring (of a ship)
to accelerate/to step on the gas
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about
to hoot/to whistle
vehicle
